data.title: Counties and nations – statistics ahead of Vasaloppet's Winter Week 2024
data.meta_description: At 09:00 on Friday, February 23, the first participants will set off on the trail in Vasaloppet's Winter Week 2024. The first race is Vasaloppet 30, which is...
data.text:
At 09:00 on Friday, February 23, the first participants will set off on the trail in Vasaloppet's Winter Week 2024. The first race is Vasaloppet 30, which is 30 km long, and it's followed by 12 other races with distances ranging from 9 to 90 kilometres before the 100th Vasaloppet in history takes place on "Vasaloppet Sunday," March 3. Currently, over 57,800 participants are registered – from 67 different nations.

57,800 skiers – from all 21 counties of Sweden and from 66 other nations across Europe, Asia, Africa, Oceania, North America, and South America – have registered for one of the 14 races in Vasaloppet's Winter Week 2024. These statistics are from Wednesday, February 21, 2024 and are thus current but not final.

The registered participants are aged 7 to 89 years. 61.2 percent are men and 38.8 percent are women. The average age of the participants is 42.2 years. (The average age in Sweden is, according to the latest available information from Statistics Sweden, 41.72 years.)

Two races are completely full: Vasaloppet and Öppet Spår Sunday. Registration is still open to all other races.

Masses of experience: 390 of the registered participants for the 90-kilometre races are what are known as Vasaloppet veterans, meaning they have participated in Vasaloppet and/or Öppet Spår/Nattvasan 90 for at least 30 years. Again this year, the veterans will wear a special orange number bib.

222 registered participants are planning to complete Vasaloppstrippeln this year, which includes skiing a race now during the Winter Week, then a mountain bike race and a running race of the same distance in Vasaloppet's Summer Week in August. Vasaloppstrippeln offers three different distances to choose from: 30, 45, and 90 km.

County by county in Vasaloppet's Winter Week 2024

Stockholm – 12,301 registered participants

Västra Götaland – 8,053

Dalarna – 4,352

Uppsala – 2,710

Skåne – 2,347

Östergötland – 1,913

Värmland – 1,838

Gävleborg – 1,799

Halland – 1,659

Jönköping – 1,627

Örebro – 1,532

Jämtland – 1,284

Västmanland – 1,232

Västernorrland – 1,150

Västerbotten – 1,100

Södermanland – 1,098

Norrbotten – 667

Kronoberg – 566

Kalmar – 449

Blekinge – 319

Gotland – 121

Not all team members in Stafettvasan and Nattvasan have been named yet, so the preliminary statistics above are based on the assumption that team members come from the same county or nation as the team captain.

Nations 2024

There are a record number of foreign participants this year: 8,408 participants represent 66 nations other than Sweden, making for a total of 67 different countries. From countries like Germany, Italy, and Estonia, twice as many participants are coming compared to last year, and three times as many participants have come from the Czech Republic.

The 20 largest foreign nations in Vasaloppet's Winter Week 2024 are:

Norway – 1,911 registered participants

Germany – 1,099

Finland – 966

Denmark – 958

Czech Republic – 943

Italy – 392

Estonia – 346

Switzerland – 295

Netherlands – 207

France – 203

Austria – 196

USA – 150

Iceland – 136

United Kingdom – 114

Poland – 89

Canada – 62

Slovakia – 60

Slovenia – 45

Belgium – 37

Australia – 27

Not all team members in Stafettvasan and Nattvasan have been named yet, so the preliminary statistics above are based on the assumption that team members come from the same county or nation as the team captain.

Registration open until start

Note! The statistics above are from Wednesday, February 21, 2024 and are therefore not final.

Read more about how registration works:

https://www.vasaloppet.se/en/registration

Follow participants in the official Vasaloppet app

Download the official Vasaloppet app, available year-round. Stay updated on everything happening around Vasaloppet and follow participants.

https://www.vasaloppet.se/en/winter/follow

Results

Start lists, live results, results lists and statistics for media are available here:

https://media.vasaloppet.se/2024/?lang=EN_CAP

username: vasa

password: media

History and facts at vasaloppet.se

On the Vasaloppet website, under the heading "History," you'll find more information and history.

https://www.vasaloppet.se/en/about-us/history

Saturday, March 2, Vasaloppet 10, freestyle, start Eldris, 9 km

Sunday, March 3, The 100th Vasaloppet, start Sälen, 90 km (Fully booked)

Vasaloppstrippeln – ski, bike and run, all in one year

Vasaloppstrippeln is a challenge where you complete three races – skiing, cycling and running – during one and the same calendar year. Choose between 30, 45 or 90 kilometres.

Like Vasaloppet on Facebook and follow Vasaloppet on Instagram!
